segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.x
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.x

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.x
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.x

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.x
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.x

segment.source: Capture and centralize your users’ application settings and Windows OS settings by implementing Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 or 2.1.
segment.target: Capture and centralize your users’ application settings and Windows OS settings by implementing Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 or 2.1.

segment.source: Then, apply these settings to the devices users access in your enterprise, like desktop computers, laptops, or virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) sessions.
segment.target: Then, apply these settings to the devices users access in your enterprise, like desktop computers, laptops, or virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) sessions.

segment.source: With UE-V you can…
segment.target: With UE-V you can…

segment.source: Specify which application and desktop settings synchronize
segment.target: Specify which application and desktop settings synchronize

segment.source: Deliver the settings anytime and anywhere users work throughout the enterprise
segment.target: Deliver the settings anytime and anywhere users work throughout the enterprise

segment.source: Create custom templates for your third-party or line-of-business applications
segment.target: Create custom templates for your third-party or line-of-business applications

segment.source: Recover settings after hardware replacement or upgrade, or after reimaging a virtual machine to its initial state
segment.target: Recover settings after hardware replacement or upgrade, or after reimaging a virtual machine to its initial state

segment.source: Components of UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Components of UE-V 2.x

segment.source: This diagram shows how deployed UE-V components work together to synchronize settings.
segment.target: This diagram shows how deployed UE-V components work together to synchronize settings.

segment.source: uev2 architectural diagram
segment.target: uev2 architectural diagram

segment.source: Component
segment.target: Component

segment.source: Function
segment.target: Function

segment.source: UE-V Agent
segment.target: UE-V Agent

segment.source: Installed on every computer that needs to synchronize settings, the UE-V Agent monitors registered applications and the operating system for any settings changes, then synchronizes those settings between computers.
segment.target: Installed on every computer that needs to synchronize settings, the UE-V Agent monitors registered applications and the operating system for any settings changes, then synchronizes those settings between computers.

segment.source: Settings packages
segment.target: Settings packages

segment.source: Application settings and Windows settings are stored in settings packages created by the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Application settings and Windows settings are stored in settings packages created by the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: Settings packages are built, locally stored, and copied to the settings storage location.
segment.target: Settings packages are built, locally stored, and copied to the settings storage location.

segment.source: The setting values for desktop applications are stored when the user closes the application.
segment.target: The setting values for desktop applications are stored when the user closes the application.

segment.source: Values for Windows settings are stored when the user logs off, when the computer is locked, or when the user disconnects remotely from a computer.
segment.target: Values for Windows settings are stored when the user logs off, when the computer is locked, or when the user disconnects remotely from a computer.

segment.source: The sync provider determines when the application or operating system settings are read from the Settings Packages and synchronized.
segment.target: The sync provider determines when the application or operating system settings are read from the Settings Packages and synchronized.

segment.source: Settings storage location
segment.target: Settings storage location

segment.source: This is a standard network share that your users can access.
segment.target: This is a standard network share that your users can access.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent verifies the location and creates a hidden system folder in which to store and retrieve user settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent verifies the location and creates a hidden system folder in which to store and retrieve user settings.

segment.source: Settings location templates
segment.target: Settings location templates

segment.source: UE-V uses XML files as settings location templates to monitor and synchronize desktop application settings and Windows desktop settings between user computers.
segment.target: UE-V uses XML files as settings location templates to monitor and synchronize desktop application settings and Windows desktop settings between user computers.

segment.source: By default, some settings location templates are included in UE-V .
segment.target: By default, some settings location templates are included in UE-V .

segment.source: You can also create, edit, or validate custom settings location templates by managing settings synchronization for custom applications.
segment.target: You can also create, edit, or validate custom settings location templates by managing settings synchronization for custom applications.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Settings location templates are not required for Windows apps.
segment.target: Settings location templates are not required for Windows apps.

segment.source: Windows app list
segment.target: Windows app list

segment.source: Settings for Windows apps are captured and applied dynamically.
segment.target: Settings for Windows apps are captured and applied dynamically.

segment.source: The app developer specifies the settings that are synchronized for each app.
segment.target: The app developer specifies the settings that are synchronized for each app.

segment.source: UE-V determines which Windows apps are enabled for settings synchronization using a managed list of apps.
segment.target: UE-V determines which Windows apps are enabled for settings synchronization using a managed list of apps.

segment.source: By default, this list includes most Windows apps.
segment.target: By default, this list includes most Windows apps.

segment.source: You can add or remove applications in the Windows app list by following the procedures shown here.
segment.target: You can add or remove applications in the Windows app list by following the procedures shown here.

segment.source: Managing Settings Synchronization for Custom Applications
segment.target: Managing Settings Synchronization for Custom Applications

segment.source: Use these UE-V components to create and manage custom templates for your third-party or line-of-business applications.
segment.target: Use these UE-V components to create and manage custom templates for your third-party or line-of-business applications.

segment.source: UE-V Generator
segment.target: UE-V Generator

segment.source: Use the UE-V Generator to create custom settings location templates that you can then distribute to user computers.
segment.target: Use the UE-V Generator to create custom settings location templates that you can then distribute to user computers.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator also lets you edit an existing template or validate a template that was created by using another XML editor.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator also lets you edit an existing template or validate a template that was created by using another XML editor.

segment.source: Settings template catalog
segment.target: Settings template catalog

segment.source: The settings template catalog is a folder path on UE-V computers or a Server Message Block (SMB) network share that stores the custom settings location templates.
segment.target: The settings template catalog is a folder path on UE-V computers or a Server Message Block (SMB) network share that stores the custom settings location templates.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent checks this location once a day, retrieves new or updated templates, and updates its synchronization behavior.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent checks this location once a day, retrieves new or updated templates, and updates its synchronization behavior.

segment.source: If you use only the UE-V default settings location templates, then a settings template catalog is unnecessary.
segment.target: If you use only the UE-V default settings location templates, then a settings template catalog is unnecessary.

segment.source: For more information about settings deployment catalogs, see Configure a UE-V settings template catalog.
segment.target: For more information about settings deployment catalogs, see Configure a UE-V settings template catalog.

segment.source: ue-v generator process
segment.target: ue-v generator process

segment.source: Settings Synchronized by Default
segment.target: Settings Synchronized by Default

segment.source: UE-V synchronizes settings for these applications by default.
segment.target: UE-V synchronizes settings for these applications by default.

segment.source: For a complete list and more detailed information, see Settings that are automatically synchronized in a UE-V deployment.
segment.target: For a complete list and more detailed information, see Settings that are automatically synchronized in a UE-V deployment.

segment.source: Microsoft Office 2013 applications (UE-V 2.1 SP1 and 2.1)
segment.target: Microsoft Office 2013 applications (UE-V 2.1 SP1 and 2.1)

segment.source: Microsoft Office 2010 applications (UE-V 2.1 SP1, 2.1, and 2.0)
segment.target: Microsoft Office 2010 applications (UE-V 2.1 SP1, 2.1, and 2.0)

segment.source: Microsoft Office 2007 applications (UE-V 2.0 only)
segment.target: Microsoft Office 2007 applications (UE-V 2.0 only)

segment.source: Internet Explorer 8, 9, and 10
segment.target: Internet Explorer 8, 9, and 10

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11 in UE-V 2.1 SP1 and 2.1
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11 in UE-V 2.1 SP1 and 2.1

segment.source: Many Windows applications, such as Xbox
segment.target: Many Windows applications, such as Xbox

segment.source: Many Windows desktop applications, such as Notepad
segment.target: Many Windows desktop applications, such as Notepad

segment.source: Many Windows settings, such as desktop background or wallpaper
segment.target: Many Windows settings, such as desktop background or wallpaper

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also customize UE-V to synchronize settings for applications other than those synchronized by default.
segment.target: You can also customize UE-V to synchronize settings for applications other than those synchronized by default.
